listening to Pastor Jerry preach but you sit

1636.31.text:
living in your old identity. Paul says this
is who you are. You're justified and reconciled.

1650.61.text:
He says this in Romans 8: Who is there to
condemn us? For Christ Jesus, who died, and

1655.80.text:
more than that was raised to life, is at the
right hand of God - and He is interceding

1660.18.text:
for us. He says stop condemning yourself.
No one else is. God is not condemning you.

1673.10.text:
Reconciliation and justification open the
door to step out of your life before Christ

1678.04.text:
and to step into this incredible journey with
Him where He can use you in the Kingdom He's

1684.27.text:
building that lasts forever. Paul says this
is who you are now that you're accepted by

1689.89.text:
God. You are justified, you are reconciled
- not because of anything you and I have done.

1697.52.text:
Understand the stark contrast of the Gospel.
World religions of this time, it was all about

1703.64.text:
sacrificing to the god so you would get their
approval - sacrificing to these angry gods

1708.86.text:
so that you would get some favor. Not the
Gospel. This is Christ who sacrificed himself

1716.51.text: for us that He might bring us to God.

1722.01.text:
There's a third thing we can grab from this
passage today and that's God's peace for us

1728.91.text:
in Christ. I want us to go back to verse 1
in this chapter because I believe this is

1734.59.text:
why Paul is explaining all that. He writes,
"Therefore since we have been justified through

1740.32.text:
faith, we have peace with God through our
Lord Jesus Christ." Therefore, since we have

1745.74.text:
been justified through faith we have peace
with God through our Lord Jesus Christ. He

1755.24.text:
wants his listeners to know that because they
have peace with God now that should trickle

1761.04.text:
down into every aspect of their life. He wants
them to know that because Christ died, there

1766.89.text:
is peace for us now. There is peace for us
today.

1770.08.text:
The same goes for you and for me. There is
peace for us today because of the sacrifice

1775.09.text:
that Jesus made on the cross. There is peace
for us today - the hostility, the tension

1784.16.text:
has been removed between you and the Alpha
and Omega. It's gone between you and the One

1792.45.text:
who is the King of Kings - who's building
the only Kingdom that's going to last forever.

1799.42.text:
That means no matter what's happening in the
here and now. No matter how tough life is

1806.84.text:
getting, all I have to do is look to Jesus
to see His love for me, the hope I have, the

1816.20.text:
fact that I'm accepted by God, and that should
bring peace to my soul.

1822.16.text:
His peace is far more than just an absence
of conflict. I understand in days like these

1827.89.text:
it's easy for us to adopt a peace that's uneasy.
With acts of terrorism, mass shootings we

1837.54.text:
can be a bit unsettled. That's not this peace.
Pastor Deone spoke of this peace a few weeks

1843.63.text:
back. The Jewish term shalom which means completeness,
soundness, harmonious well-being - that's

1854.88.text:
Isaiah, a prophet in the Old Testament writes
of this peace. He says, "The fruit of that

1860.37.text:
righteousness will be peace; its effect will
be quietness and confidence forever. My people

1865.57.text:
will live in peaceful dwelling places, in
secure homes, in undisturbed places of rest."

1872.51.text:
Wow! Quiet? Yeah. Quietness and confidence
forever - it says, "My people are going to

1880.45.text:
be living in peaceful dwelling places, in
secure homes, in undisturbed places of rest."

1886.45.text:
That's our future for those of us who are
in Christ. That's our future. But he wants

1892.43.text: that same peace for you now.

1898.48.text:
Paul wants for his listeners the same thing
Pastor Jonathan wanted for us last week in

1904.89.text:
his message. He wants us to understand that
Jesus is more than enough. He's everything

1913.26.text:
we could have ever asked for. You and I can
have nothing on this planet, but if we have

1919.68.text:
Jesus, we've got everything. Flip side of
that - you and I could manage to gain this

1932.97.text:
whole world, even if we could figure out how
to do that, but if we don't have Jesus, we

1939.88.text:
So if you're here today, you're watching online
- if you don't have Jesus, you don't have

1946.44.text:
peace with God. You don't have this peace
that the Scriptures speak of. There is peace

1958.44.text:
for you today because there is no longer any
hostility between you and God.

1964.26.text:
Now that doesn't excuse, that doesn't forget.
We're not naïve to the fact that life gets

1971.80.text:
tough. Life is about adversity, isn't it?
The rich or the poor - it rains on both. Sure,

1979.72.text:
there's plenty of times in life where it's
like running downhill, isn't it? Almost as

1984.99.text:
if momentum's carrying us - life is going
so easy. Life is going so great. Reality is

1992.71.text:
a storm is always coming where we have to
run - it feels like life is running uphill,

1999.07.text:
the wind is crashing against our face. It's
tough. We don't ignore that. But we have a

2007.57.text:
peace - a peace that's rooted in hope. He
says this in verse 5 - a hope that we have

2014.66.text:
in Christ. A hope that does not disappoint.
A hope that does not put us to shame because

2022.11.text:
we know who holds our future and we know what
our future is.

2029.84.text:
So Paul's invitation to his listeners - God's
invitation by His Spirit to us today as he

2035.24.text:
revealed in the Scriptures to recognize God's
great love for you and for me; that while

2042.22.text:
we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
And that when God accepts us, we are now justified

2049.41.text:
before the just judge. We are now reconciled
before Him. There's no longer any tension

2054.87.text:
between us. That's why the Scriptures invite
us to come boldly and confidently to the throne

2059.39.text:
of God. That's who you are. All of that should
bring peace to your soul - that even when

2068.24.text:
you go through trials, even when your faith
is tested, you are rooted in the fact of God's

2074.93.text:
love for you and who you are in Christ. That's
what He wants for us today.

2084.67.text:
If you would please, pray with me. Heads bowed
and eyes closed. In many ways, I believe this

2095.97.text:
is our most important time together because
this is where you get to respond to God's

2101.27.text:
truth. This is where you get to respond to
the Scriptures.

2110.43.text:
Perhaps you're sitting here this morning,
and maybe even this is your first time with

2114.04.text:
us, but in our time together you've realized
one thing. You don't have Christ. You've never

2125.22.text:
come to that place where you believed and
received all that Jesus has. I want to invite

2135.49.text:
you after service to stop by the Fireside
Room. It's directly across our atrium. You

2145.15.text:
can't miss it. It's easily labeled. Stop by
and talk with one of our prayer partners or

2150.49.text:
one of our pastors. I don't know what you
have going on after this service. They're

2156.68.text:
not going to keep you long but whatever you
have going on after the service - it pales

2161.46.text:
in comparison to what God is doing in your
heart right now. Stop by. We want to pray

2167.54.text:
for you. We want to help you on a journey
with Christ. All we want to do is help. We've

2174.43.text:
got something we want to put in your hands
for later. You're not signing up for the church.

2177.88.text:
We just want to pray with you and get something
in your hand and help you in your new life

2187.67.text:
Maybe you're sitting here and you've been
following Jesus longer than I've been alive.

2194.24.text:
How do you respond to the message this morning?
Maybe you're sitting here and life has been

2205.79.text:
tough. Maybe you've just recently experienced
loss of someone dear to you, maybe even a

2217.35.text:
job. Maybe you're going through tough times
yourself. What is God speaking to your heart

2228.35.text:
this morning? Give it to Him. Give it to the
One who wants to give you a peace that surpasses

2237.97.text:
all understanding. A peace where regardless
of what's happening to our left or to our

2246.00.text:
right we know where we stand with God. We
know what our future is.

2254.78.text:
Father, may we be a people who lives in your
peace. May we be a people that when others

2265.58.text:
look to us, see your peace and notice that
there's something different about us and that's

2273.74.text:
not because of anything from us but because
they see You, Jesus. Father, give us a great

2285.06.text:
courageous and bold faith to follow You wherever
you lead because we know where You are there

2293.30.text:
is life. Thank you, Jesus. For it's in Your
name we pray. Amen.

2300.37.text:
May the grace of God and His peace be with
you this week. Thank you for being so gracious.
